Shows your top 9 most used Unicode characters

# Alfred-UTF: Unicode Character Search
Simple workflow to replace now defunct Python 2 workflow. Uses pure SQLite3 - with fts5 and json1 extensions - which is still packaged with MacOS, unlike PHP or Python 2 in versions of MacOS 13+.
## Usage
- `utf right arr` - Search for a Unicode character - Default action: copy the character (e.g. `→`) - <kbd>Cmd</kbd> - copy the HTML version (e.g. `→`) - <kbd>Option</kbd> - copy the Unicode point for js/php/python/… (e.g. `\u2192`) - <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> - copy the decimal value for whatever reason (e.g. `2192`) - `utf :whatever*` - If your query starts with **colon**, you are writing raw SQLite fts5 match syntax. Use only if you desire to fool around with stuff. - `utf10` - Top 10 characters you've used in the past, with count of times you've used them
## Installation
1. Download the workflow 2. Use the workflow
